Posts.Content: Hi, The oncologist said I have to go back weekly until the results come back. Yes my husband comes with me. I have just started writing my concerns down, as I’d forgotten most of my questions when I seen him yesterday. Thank you. Xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi kacang, I really appreciate your reply. I have had 5 lymph nodes removed and the cancer had not spread. It is hormone. Grade 2. I don’t have anymore information. Oncology said to read all I can about chemotherapy ( not dr Google) as I will probably need it. I’m a little confused. You are right I do need to recover from surgery ( still in some discomfort) and take things 1 step at a time, just hoping I would have my treatment plan now and know what I’m up against. Thank you for listening to me waffle. Xxxx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I’ve been diagnosed with breast cancer and went for my 1st oncology appointment yesterday, unfortunately not all my results are back. (I had my op 8/11) has anyone else had to wait this long? Any help will be gratefully received. Xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi sue, thank you for your reply. I am so pleased yours is going well for you (as well as it Can I guess) Im probably expecting things to happen quicker than what it actually is. Im waiting to see if it’s her2 + so it will go from there. Is it as bad as I’m thinking it’s going to be? How do you cope? I’m sorry for going on, my mind is a bit of a mess at the moment.Â  Thank you for your reply Bazzy Xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, Thank you again. I’m waiting to see if it’s her2+. He told me to prepare for chemotherapy radiotherapy and some other drugs. I’m so confused by it all. Thank you. Bazzy. Xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi kacang, Thank you so much for the link. Oncologist did mention it but it’s all a bit of a blur. Thank you. Xxxx
